Each Friday the Reno County Health Department releases the 14 day PTR (positive test rate) and the 14 day new case average. This is the second week in a rolling two week average for schools. The data released dictates the gating criteria color we follow for the coming week. Until our community testing rate gets to 1.8% of our population for a 2 week period (3.6% of our population for the month), we will use the new cases for determining criteria color.

Currently the numbers are:

14 Day PTR-9/11, 7.30%
14 Day New Case-9/11, 67 (this is down from last week)

Starting Monday, September 14th we will be in the YELLOW zone. The Gating Criteria for Buhler is attached. To track our weekly numbers, please refer to this site: https://sites.google.com/usd313.org/returntolearn2020

It is crucial that we all do our best to help keep our schools open by wearing masks, staying home when sick, washing hands regularly, and social distancing.

Cindy Couchman, Superintendent

post_text: As you may have read in the news, the USDA has opened up waivers to extend the summer meal program until December 31, 2020 or until federal funds are no longer available. Buhler's Food Service Director, Kay Cox, was awarded the waiver. Starting Wednesday, September 2nd, all Buhler USD 313 students who eat breakfast or lunch will not be charged through Dec. 31. Families who normally would pay the full rate or the reduced rate for meals will not be charged during this time. Students will have to pay for Ala carte items. District families still need to fill out the free/reduced application because meals after Dec 31st will be charged according to their student meal status. The free/reduced application also is needed on file for families to qualify for free or reduced-price fees. This application helps our district receive additional state and federal funding needed to provide resources for our students. You can find the application online at myschoolapps.com

VACCINATION CLINIC!!!

There will be another clinic tomorrow, July 28th, at Prairie Hills Middle School from 2-6 pm.

To help families prepare for the first day of school a vaccination clinic has been planned by USD 313 in collaboration with the Reno County Health Department.

To receive vaccinations parents must fill out this form https://4.files.edl.io/55ac/02/12/20/204737-a2a16395-7e54-42a1-94c6-d6eb65d71041.pdf and provide their insurance card. Forms will be present at the site if parents are unable to print off from the district website.

Students who do not have an exemption for immunizations due to either religious or medical reasons will be required to be current on all vaccinations before coming to school. The list of vaccinations required can be found at https://www.kdheks.gov/immunize/download/2020-2021_School_Requirement_K-12.pdf?fbclid=IwAR0VBYuX_Pplb_GGOfH_p58n4LSMDVaYRdN7PN-HzBVC1iGacxeYLQ2fpy0

Thank you to our teachers! - During this final day of teacher appreciation week we want to add to the many kind messages we have seen the last five days.

Seven weeks ago we found out that we would not gather with our students again in our school buildings. The resilience and love we have seen from our teachers since then can only be described as remarkable. Without batting an eye, our teachers shifted to continuous and online learning with speed, grace, and determination. They have shared messages of sadness due to missing their students, joy in seeing them all again online, and hope for their futures.

The time and dedication our teachers put into their craft has been most evident these past weeks, but we know it is there each and every day through more normal circumstances as well. One week is truly not enough to express our appreciation for our educators. Thank you, Buhler teachers, for the learning and love you share with students each and every day, week, and year! http://edl.io/n1225183

This means in order for all children in your household to receive a meal you must bring all of them on the day you pick up your permit. Once you receive your permit, you will just need to have the permit displayed on the dashboard of your vehicle in order to receive meals.

You are still welcome to bring your children with you as we do enjoy seeing them.

We are hoping by allowing families to pick up meals without children will reduce the risk of exposure for both families and our staff.

USD 313 BOARD OF EDUCATION TO INTERVIEW SUPERINTENDENT CANDIDATE

Mrs. Cindy Couchman will be interviewing for the position of superintendent with the board of education the afternoon of March 26, 2020.

Mrs. Cindy Couchman is the third of three candidates that the USD 313 Buhler board of education will be interviewing. Candidates were selected for interviews based on their fit with desired characteristics that were developed with input from focus groups that were utilized throughout the search process.

Mrs. Couchman is currently serving as the assistant superintendent of schools in USD 313. She is in her sixth year in that position. Previously, Mrs. Couchman taught mathematics at Buhler High School for 19 years.

Mrs. Cindy Couchman will meet with the Board at 3:00 pm for her formal interview, conducted in executive session.

The board of education will conclude interviews on March 26, 2020. They will then determine which candidate is the best fit for the superintendent position in USD 313 Buhler Public Schools.

USD 313 BOARD OF EDUCATION TO INTERVIEW SUPERINTENDENT CANDIDATE

Dr. Paul Erickson will be interviewing for the position of superintendent with the board of education on the evening of March 23, 2020.

Dr. Erickson is the first of three candidates that the USD 313 Buhler board of education will be interviewing. Candidates were selected for interviews based on their fit with desired characteristics that were developed with input from focus groups that were utilized throughout the search process.

Dr. Erickson is currently serving as the principal of Union Valley Elementary School in USD 313. He is in his fifth year in that position. Previously, Dr. Erickson served as a classroom teacher and principal for 8 years in Inman and a classroom teacher in Hutchinson for three years.

Dr. Erickson will meet with the Board at 6:30 pm for his formal interview, conducted in executive session.

The board of education will conclude interviews on March 26, 2020. They will then determine which candidate is the best fit for the superintendent position in USD 313 Buhler Public Schools.

Superintendent Search Information - The USD 313 School Board has set a timeline it will follow to select its next Superintendent of Schools.

The School Board plans to announce its choice for the next Superintendent of Schools during the first week of April. It has contracted with the Kansas Association of School Boards(KASB) to conduct a search. KASB has conducted meetings with various stakeholder and staff groups to determine the attributes, skills, and character traits Buhler Schools would most benefit from in a candidate. The results of those sessions was shared with the board last Wednesday in a special board meeting. Applications for the position are due this Friday, February 28th. Next week there will be a special meeting of the board to choose the top candidates that will be offered an interview. Interviews will take place during the week of March 23rd through March 27th. Each candidate will be announced on district social media the morning of their interview along with a schedule for the day.

Baker responsibilities: Baking bread items from scratch, preparing desserts, and serving.

Cook's Assistant responsibilities: Help cook various items and serve food to students.

Pay is based on experience

If interested, contact Kay Cox at the Central Office for more information, or Tammy Heidel to apply. You may also apply online by going here - https://www.applitrack.com/buhlerschools/onlineapp/default.aspx?Category=Food+Service
